triples.name: Second-language acquisition
triples.relevance: The paper addresses how phonetic systems reorganize in response to L2 learning, which is central to second-language acquisition research.

triples.name: Language acquisition
triples.relevance: The model proposes that mechanisms for L1 acquisition remain accessible for L2 learning, directly engaging with language acquisition theory.

triples.name: Phonetics
triples.relevance: Phonetics is the foundational discipline for studying how phonetic systems reorganize and how phonetic categories are perceived and produced.

triples.name: Phoneme
triples.relevance: Phonemic distinctions form the basis of the phonetic categories and L1-L2 interactions that the SLM-r model describes.

triples.name: Speech perception
triples.relevance: The SLM-r proposes a revised framework for understanding how speech perception and phonetic categorization mechanisms operate across the lifespan in L2 learning.
